mainTopic.title: Gross anatomy of urine transport
mainTopic.content_info: The content includes both anatomical and physiological information, however in each subtopic we only need the anatomical information to be turned into revision questions

quizzes.question: What is the primary function of the ureters in the urinary system?
quizzes.goodAnswer: To transport urine from the kidneys to the bladder
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: To filter blood and create urine
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: To excrete urine from the body

quizzes.question: How are the ureters structurally adapted for their function?
quizzes.goodAnswer: They are muscular tubes that propel urine via peristaltic movements
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: They have a large storage capacity to hold urine until micturition
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: They contain valves that regulate urine production
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: They are lined with villi to increase absorption
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: They have external sphincters at the junction to the bladder

quizzes.question: What is the location of the ureters in relation to the peritoneum?
quizzes.goodAnswer: They are retroperitoneal, positioned behind the peritoneum
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: They are intraperitoneal, located inside the peritoneal cavity
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: They lie within the external muscular layer of the peritoneum
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: They are anteroposterior, running along the anterior abdominal wall
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: They are subperitoneal, found beneath the peritoneal lining of the abdomen

quizzes.question: What is the primary function of the bladder in the urinary system?
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Produces hormones like EPO and calcitriol
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Secretes excess ions and wastes into the renal tubules

quizzes.question: Which muscle plays a critical role in the contraction and expansion of the bladder?
Where is the bladder located?
quizzes.goodAnswer: It is a retroperitoneal organ located in the pelvic bone
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: It is situated in the lower abdomen above the pelvic bone
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: It is an intraperitoneal organ located in the upper abdomen
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: It is located behind the gastrointestinal tract in the abdominal cavity
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: It is positioned within the thoracic cavity near the kidneys

quizzes.question: What is the typical capacity of the bladder?
What is the primary function of the urethra in the urinary system?
quizzes.goodAnswer: To transport urine from the bladder out of the body
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: To carry urine from the kidneys to the bladder
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: To reabsorb water and electrolytes from urine
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: To filter blood and produce urine

quizzes.question: How does the urethra differ anatomically between males and females?
quizzes.goodAnswer: In females, it is shorter and solely for urine transport, while in males, it's longer and serves for both urine and semen transport
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: In males, it is shorter and used only for urination
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: In females, it facilitates the transport of both urine and reproductive fluids
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Both males and females have urethras that serve equally for urine and semen transport
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: The female urethra is external and more exposed, making it prone to infections

quizzes.question: What mechanism helps to prevent urine leakage?
quizzes.goodAnswer: The urethral sphincters control the flow of urine
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Capillary action in the urethral lining prevents leakage
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: Gravitational forces keep the urine in place
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Active transport mechanisms reabsorb leaked urine
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Peristaltic movements of the urethra push urine out efficiently
